title: How to nerf Lucian without ruining bork for all the other adcs
body:
Simply make his passive only apply on-hit effects on the first hit. 

Bork may still need nerfs, but doing this will keep Lucian in line while not gutting him because he found another build. It also allows riot to balance bork for all adcs as opposed to gutting it because one of them abuses it too hard

replies.body: That's clever. And seems very reasonable, other items will not be affected except BC, which it also would still proc with his Ult. Upvoted to help riot see this.
Black cleaver would still be applied.  Black cleaver is not an on hit effect.  It clearly states "dealing physical damage."
Isn't that what he said??

Thanks for clarification.

If we're going to Lucian, the one's I'd be looking at doing are:

* Changing the E rankup to do something other than diminish the mana cost. Essence Reaver should be a legitimate choice for a champion like Lucian, so it seems off that he can build other heavy CDR builds without having to solve his Mana problems. 
* Changing the ult to not deal 4x to minions. Using minions to obstruct his blockable ultimate seems like a reasonable play for opponents to make, but I feel like it's mostly denied by this mechanic on his R. Also, I'm pretty sure the 4x modifier on this allows him to get massive healing off Death's Dance when used on minions (which I believe is a build starting to pick up in popularity), but I'd have to double check that.

Both of these could hit him in the feels, but they don't really affect his top end case, so they seem reasonable to me.

What about nerfs to {{item:3071}}? This item has been one of if not the most universally bought item for way too long. IMO it's CDR should be removed so that it's at least a little by more niche and not good on every AD champ in the game.
edit: lucian has always abused this item, and even now that he's abusing {{item:3153}}, it's arguable that he's abusing cleaver to abuse BORK, since the armor shed buffs the BORK passive as well as lucian passive let's him artificially increase his AA's with CDR.

That's a fair sentiment, but it did get its shred reduced in 7.9.

Black Cleaver is intended to be a core first purchase item for many users to get them up and running, in a similar way that Morellonomicon is. If Lucian building it is undesirable, I think we should try to make Lucian feel a cost for going down that path before nerfing the item again.

I feel that BC is overpowered on many champions, not just Lucian. I really appreciate the nerf it got but it's still extremely strong. And worst of all, I feel that its power varies too greatly, even among champions meant to buy it first, due to the way its stacks can be applied.

In regards to Lucian and mana: Running out of mana is extremely unfun. If Lucian truly needs mana from items to function it can work out, but if Riot rides the line tight enough you just end up with a champ that deletes people super fast then goes back to base often because few people are going to opt for lower damage if there's any chance they can get away with higher damage.

Keep in mind tight mana restrictions could hurt Lucian's early game 'bullying' which will make him very week outside of favorable matchups. I get that a change to his E with ranks is meant to avoid that issue by making it a mid game only change but I have strong doubts it can be tuned correctly for a wide variety of ELOs and matchups. And mostly I think there are far better options, including the original suggestion of this thread.

>In regards to Lucian and mana: Running out of mana is extremely unfun.

Having an enemy Lucian dash around every 2 seconds with no actual cost is even more unfun. 

>Keep in mind tight mana restrictions could hurt Lucian's early game 'bullying' which will make him very week outside of favorable matchups.

From what I understand this wouldn't be increasing the rank 1 mana cost, rather making it a static 40 at all ranks. Seems like a solid change to me.

yes, this is what im scared of. Lucian depends on his early game to get ahead as he is not a hyper carry adc. Forcing him to build ER zeal, the worst powerspike of all the traditional items, would really hurt his early game.

I think the goal isn't to "force" him into a build path, but require tradeoffs for selecting a buildpath. Want to stick with the current buildpath and keep the damage? Fine, but you have to be more mindful of your mana usage and thus mobility (E). 

Want the mobility? Fine, take ER/zeal, but pay with less damage early.  

Cosnirak sees this as a negative:

> but if Riot rides the line tight enough you just end up with a champ that deletes people super fast then goes back to base often because few people are going to opt for lower damage if there's any chance they can get away with higher damage.


But Riot may not. Someone who deletes other super fast but has to constantly go back to base is someone who is in the field less pushing down lanes and objectives or applying pressure. They can still stay out there but then risk getting caught with no mana.

Black Cleaver CDR 20% -> 10%

CDR buffs for its "intended users"?

I can see it's meant for brawly top laners being able to soften their tank opponents. Although I don't think it's right that you hold those champions balance hostage to an actually fundamentally problematic item that has nothing in place stopping characters with other advantages using it. Who use it better because they're ranged with better target access and get peeled for.

Lucian isn't gonna drop Black Cleaver just because you choke his mana costs a bit. The item lets him be target agnostic and it makes him tankier. He's made Vayne look pointless at times with these builds.

It also doesn't help graves insta stacks black cleaver for his ADC friend. Did someone go out of their way to code that abominable synergy because it seems like grave's bullets applies damage together?

Overall this'll allow more power budget for the actual pen/stats of the item and leave more room for juggers to grab frozen heart and ect. Or maybe a slightly lower cost will get juggers off the ground faster and lower its slot efficiency for carries. True though that the last time BC was cheap tanks were pushed out of top lane even when sunfire was stronger. Maybe it should stay more premium so carries really pay for it...

Could open up some options too. " They need this item to function" and they're not even prevalent with the item compared to others is just a red flag to me. The item is too much a clutch. Especially since the item is mean vs. themself too.

The way I see it I see champions and items and masteries in seperate vacuums. And in those you see trends. And they usually mean something. And using one to compensate another is just masking a problem. Hybrid champions have a lot of fun with it with Mordekaiser making great use of the best frontline and AP items when he was good (Rylias/ect.) or I can stick both gunblade and Bork with Fervor on Teemo and if farmed well that's a strong build. I don't think it's fantastic that Darius is tuned to balance for low elo while requiring a suspiciously prominent item to function.

Would it be possible to make Piercing Light's cast time and/or cooldown scale down with Lucian's bonus Attack Speed rather than CDR or level, similar to how Yasuo's Q works? 

Due to the way Lucian's kit works, there's not much incentive to building AS over CDR on him _(Phantom Dancer is bought because its passives are strong on Lucian and synergize nicely with Cleaver's Rage, with the AS mostly being a bonus)_, which in turn makes crit builds less attractive because a large part of crit builds is AS.

The only way to make Cleaver feel like a trade-off for Lucian _(without changing Cleaver at all)_ is for Lucian to not benefit as much from the CDR in some manner. CDR does everything for him, after all. Better poke by lowering Q/W cooldowns, better kiting by lowering W/E cooldowns and having the Rage passive... There's no real trade-off anywhere.

... If the ability itself worked like that, I would imagine it would apply _all_ the stacks, because:

1. The attack would land, causing on-hit effects and activating the Runic Blade buff.
2. The Runic Blade buff adds additional damage to the attack, subtracts a stack, and applies on-hit effects ... and activating itself, if it still has a stack.
3. Additional damage is added, stack is subtracted, on-hit effects are applied ... and once more, the buff is activated if it still has a stack remaining.
4. Additional damage is added, stack is subtracted, on-hit effects applied, and at this point, it's not possible to have any more stacks.

So that's 75% - 150% of your AD as bonus damage, on-hits applied _four times_, and a very hurt or very dead target. 'Course, there'd be ways to code it to avoid that, but it'd actually be kinda interesting to have a charged on-hit effect that applies on-hit effects again, effectively looping until it was out of charges. It'd easily fall into the same pitfalls the 5.0 attack speed Kog'maw did, of course, but still.
